diseases.name: Apple Scab
diseases.introduction: A serious fungal disease that causes scabby spots on leaves and fruit, making apples cracked and deformed.
symptoms: Leaves turn yellow and drop early.
Fruit develops rough, scabby, dark spots.
immediateActions: Rake and destroy fallen leaves to reduce overwintering spores.
Prune trees to open the canopy for sunlight and air.
naturalControl: Apply organic liquid copper soap sprays two weeks before symptoms usually appear.
Use sulfur sprays or dusts as a preventative fungicide.
Plant resistant varieties like Honeycrisp or Liberty.
chemicalControl: Apply fungicides containing Captan or Myclobutanil early in the season.
Spray Mancozeb protectively before rain events.
Use systemic fungicides like Difenoconazole during rapid leaf growth.
prevention: Water in the morning to allow leaves to dry.

diseases.name: Apple Black Rot
diseases.introduction: A fungus that infects fruit, leaves, and bark. It causes 'Frog-eye' leaf spots and rotting fruit.
symptoms: Purple spots on leaves that enlarge with a light center ('Frog-eye').
Firm, rotting spots on fruit that turn black and mummified.
immediateActions: Remove mummified fruit from the tree.
Prune out dead wood and cankers.
naturalControl: Coat pruning wounds with wound sealer or latex paint.
Remove dead wood and mummies from the orchard floor.
Use Kaolin clay sprays to discourage insect vectors.
chemicalControl: Use copper-based fungicides during the dormant season.
Apply Strobilurin fungicides during fruit development.
prevention: Keep the orchard clean of dead wood.

diseases.name: Cotton Bacterial Blight
diseases.introduction: Also known as 'Black Arm', this bacterial disease attacks all parts of the cotton plant causing seedling blight and boll rot.
symptoms: Bolls rot and do not open properly.
immediateActions: Do not save seeds from infected plants.
naturalControl: Soak seeds in cow urine or hot water (56째C for 10 mins) before sowing.
Spray Neem oil to control insect vectors that create wounds.
Use biocontrol agents like Pseudomonas fluorescens.
chemicalControl: Spray Copper Oxychloride (3g/L) mixed with Streptocycline (100ppm).

diseases.name: Mango Bacterial Canker
diseases.introduction: A severe disease causing black spots on leaves and fruit, often leading to fruit drop.
symptoms: Water-soaked black spots on leaves surrounded by a yellow halo.
Cankerous lesions on twigs and branches.
Fruit develops black cracks producing gum.
immediateActions: Prune infected twigs and burn them.
Collect and destroy fallen infected fruits.
naturalControl: Protect young orchards from strong winds (which cause wounds) by planting windbreaks.
Spray Neem seed kernel extract (5%).
Use Mango Ginger extract sprays.
chemicalControl: Spray Streptocycline (200ppm) alternately with Copper Oxychloride (0.3%).
Apply Bordeaux mixture (1%) to tree trunks.

diseases.name: Mango Anthracnose
diseases.introduction: The most common mango disease, favored by wet weather, causing blossom blight and fruit rot.
symptoms: Black spots on leaves and flowers.
Flower blight (flowers turn black and drop).
immediateActions: Harvest fruit early if rain is expected.
naturalControl: Hot water treatment of fruits (52째C for 5-10 mins) after harvest.
Spray chili-garlic extract.
Ensure good sunlight penetration into the canopy.
chemicalControl: Use Copper Oxychloride as a cover spray.

diseases.name: Cauliflower Black Rot
diseases.introduction: A bacterial disease characterized by V-shaped yellow lesions on leaf edges.
symptoms: Veins within the yellow area turn black.
naturalControl: Crop rotation with non-cruciferous crops for at least 3 years.
Treat seeds with hot water (50째C for 30 minutes) before planting.
Use mulch to prevent soil splash.
chemicalControl: Spray Copper Hydroxide or Copper Oxychloride.
Use Mancozeb as a preventative measure.
prevention: Use raised beds for better drainage.

diseases.name: Rice Brown Spot
diseases.introduction: A fungal disease often associated with poor soil fertility causing yield loss.
symptoms: Oval, brown spots with a grey or whitish center on leaves.
Leaves dry out in severe cases.
naturalControl: Treat seeds with Trichoderma viride (10g/kg) before sowing.
Apply neem cake to the soil.
Spray fresh cow dung slurry (20%).

diseases.name: Rice Leaf Blast
diseases.introduction: A destructive fungal disease that causes diamond-shaped lesions and can break the stem.
symptoms: Eye-shaped or diamond-shaped spots with gray centers.
Stem nodes turn black and break ('Rotten Neck').
naturalControl: Spray Pseudomonas fluorescens (0.5%) on foliage.
Use silica supplements (like burnt rice husk) to strengthen cell walls.
Destroy infected straw and stubble.
chemicalControl: Spray Tricyclazole (0.6g/L) immediately upon symptom appearance.
prevention: Plant early to avoid peak disease season.

diseases.name: Potato Early Blight
diseases.introduction: A common fungal disease affecting older leaves, causing 'bullseye' spots.
symptoms: Brown spots with concentric rings (target board effect).
naturalControl: Mulch with straw to prevent fungal spores from splashing onto leaves.
Use Trichoderma harzianum soil applications.
Spray compost tea or sodium bicarbonate solution.
chemicalControl: Spray Chlorothalonil or Mancozeb every 7-10 days.
Use Copper Hydroxide as a protectant.

diseases.name: Potato Late Blight
diseases.introduction: The disease that caused the Irish Potato Famine. It destroys crops rapidly in wet weather.
symptoms: Water-soaked dark spots on leaf edges.
White fungal growth on the underside of leaves.
Tubers rot with a foul smell.
naturalControl: Kill vines 2 weeks before harvest to prevent tuber infection.
Hilling (piling soil) around the base of plants.
Apply copper-based organic fungicides regularly.
chemicalControl: Use Cymoxanil or Dimethomorph for curative action.

diseases.name: Tomato Early Blight
diseases.introduction: Affects stems, leaves, and fruit, usually starting on older foliage near the ground.
immediateActions: Stake plants to keep them off the ground.
naturalControl: Remove lower leaves to improve air circulation.
Spray baking soda solution (1 tbsp baking soda + 1 tsp oil + 1 gal water).
Use Serenade (Bacillus subtilis) bio-fungicide.

diseases.name: Tomato Late Blight
diseases.introduction: A rapid killer of tomato plants in cool, wet weather.
immediateActions: Remove infected plants entirely (do not compost).
naturalControl: Use copper sprays as a preventative measure.
Provide extra space between plants.
Grow under plastic tunnels to keep foliage dry.
chemicalControl: Curative sprays of Dimethomorph or Cymoxanil.

diseases.name: Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
diseases.introduction: A viral disease transmitted by whiteflies that severely stunts growth.
symptoms: Leaves curl upwards and turn yellow margins.
immediateActions: Install yellow sticky traps for whiteflies.
naturalControl: Spray Neem oil or insecticidal soap to control whiteflies.
Use reflective mulches (silver/aluminum) to repel whiteflies.
Plant trap crops like marigolds.

diseases.name: Corn Northern Leaf Blight
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing large lesions that reduce photosynthesis and yield.
symptoms: Lesions can be up to 10-15 cm long.
immediateActions: Harvest early if infection is severe late in season.
naturalControl: Crop rotation with non-grass crops (e.g., soybeans).
Tillage to bury infected crop residue.
Use bio-control agents like Trichoderma.
chemicalControl: Spray Mancozeb or Propiconazole at tasseling stage.
Apply fungicides if lesions appear on the ear leaf.

diseases.name: Sugarcane Red Rot
diseases.introduction: The 'Cancer of Sugarcane'. It causes the stalk to rot internally.
symptoms: Reddening of internal tissues with white cross-bands.
immediateActions: Avoid water flowing from infected to healthy fields.
naturalControl: Use moist hot air treatment (54째C for 2.5 hours) for seed setts.
Crop rotation with rice or green manure crops.
Use Trichoderma viride in the soil.
chemicalControl: Dip setts in Carbendazim (0.1%) before planting.
No effective chemical cure for standing crop once infected.

diseases.name: Sugarcane Rust
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease appearing as orange/brown pustules on leaves.
symptoms: Elongated orange or brown pustules on leaves.
Leaves look rusty from a distance.
naturalControl: Avoid excessive nitrogen application.
Maintain good drainage.
Remove alternative weed hosts.
prevention: Plant at the correct time to avoid peak humidity.

diseases.name: Citrus Greening (HLB)
diseases.introduction: Also known as Yellow Dragon Disease. It is incurable and fatal to citrus trees.
symptoms: Fruit stays green at the bottom (inverted color).
immediateActions: Remove and destroy the infected tree immediately to save the orchard.
naturalControl: Release parasitic wasps (Tamarixia radiata) to control the psyllid vector.
Use guava as an intercrop (repels psyllids).
Spray Kaolin clay to deter insects.
chemicalControl: Control the Psyllid vector using Imidacloprid or Dimethoate.
Apply antibiotics (Oxytetracycline) via trunk injection (temporary relief only).

diseases.name: Pumpkin Powdery Mildew
diseases.introduction: White powdery fungal growth on leaves that reduces yield.
symptoms: White, talcum-powder like growth on upper and lower leaf surfaces.
Leaves turn yellow and dry out.
naturalControl: Spray milk solution (1 part milk to 9 parts water).
Use Neem oil or Sulfur dust.
Apply baking soda mixture.

diseases.name: Healthy Tomato
diseases.introduction: Your plant looks healthy and vigorous! Keep up the good work.

diseases.name: Healthy Potato
diseases.introduction: Excellent! No disease detected on this potato plant.
immediateActions: Ensure soil is earthed up around tubers.
prevention: Monitor weekly for early signs of blight.
Ensure tubers are covered with soil.
